Events.RelatedDescription: Merged pull request "[Hotfix] Don't throw when adding a package owner without a message" (#7383) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened pull request "[Hotfix] Don't throw when adding a package owner without a message" (#7383) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Opened issue "Adding an owner without a message fails when sending email" (#7382) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
It appears that adding owners without a message is failing to send emails on PROD.
Fortunately the owner is still being added, but the email is failing to send.

# Reproduction steps:
1. Go to the manage page for a package you own.
2. In the owners section, enter a username, leave the "message" field blank, and submit.

Expected:
- email is sent
- owner shows up in list on page as "pending"

Actual:
"Internal Server Error" is displayed on page

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "[Azure Search] Increase tag field weight" (#7381) at NuGet/NuGetGallery
Events.RelatedBody:
Try to improve the following queries:

* aad -> microsoft.identitymodel.clients.activedirectory
* excel -> EPPlus
* mail -> SendGrid, Mailkit
* ml.net ->Microsoft.ML
* orm -> Dapper
* rx -> System.Reactive
* mysql -> MySqlConnector

Events.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "IVsPackageSourceProvider.GetSources(â€¦) has ill-defined exception behavior" (#8383) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
While `NuGet.VisualStudio.IVsPackageSourceProvider.GetSources(â€¦)` has [no formally defined throwable exceptions](https://github.com/NuGet/Home/issues/8380), [this comment](https://github.com/dotnet/roslyn/pull/21066#issuecomment-317567025) is the best definition so far.

This has led to internal issues 468626 and 733658.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Test:  Dotnet.Integration.Test.PackCommandTests.PackCommand_PackProject_PackageReferenceFloatingVersionRange is flaky" (#8394) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
Test Dotnet.Integration.Test.PackCommandTests.PackCommand_PackProject_PackageReferenceFloatingVersionRange is flaky.
```
  [xUnit.net 00:49:25.5928107]     Dotnet.Integration.Test.PackCommandTests.PackCommand_PackProject_PackageReferenceFloatingVersionRange [FAIL]

EXEC : warning Message:  [C:\git\NuGet.Client\build\build.proj]
     Restore failed with following log information :
     Retrying 'FindPackagesByIdAsyncCore' for source 'https://test3.net/FindPackagesById()?id='Newtonsoft.Json'&semVerLevel=2.0.0'.
    The SSL connection could not be established, see inner exception.
      The remote certificate is invalid according to the validation procedure.

    The SSL connection could not be established, see inner exception.
      The remote certificate is invalid according to the validation procedure.
C:\git\NuGet.Client\.test\work\0e604d6a\f2a85a0e\sdk\2.2.301-preview-010200\NuGet.targets(123,5): warning : Failed to retrieve information about 'Newtonsoft.Json' from remote source 'https://test3.net/FindPackagesById()?id='Newtonsoft.Json'&semVerLevel=2.0.0'. [C:\git\NuGet.Client\.test\work\2ce3c1b1\faf0586b\ClassLibrary1\ClassLibrary1.csproj] [C:\git\NuGet.Client\build\build.proj]
C:\git\NuGet.Client\.test\work\0e604d6a\f2a85a0e\sdk\2.2.301-preview-010200\NuGet.targets(123,5): warning : The SSL connection could not be established, see inner exception. [C:\git\NuGet.Client\.test\work\2ce3c1b1\faf0586b\ClassLibrary1\
ClassLibrary1.csproj] [C:\git\NuGet.Client\build\build.proj]
C:\git\NuGet.Client\.test\work\0e604d6a\f2a85a0e\sdk\2.2.301-preview-010200\NuGet.targets(123,5): warning : The remote certificate is invalid according to the validation procedure. [C:\git\NuGet.Client\.test\work\2ce3c1b1\faf0586b\ClassLi
brary1\ClassLibrary1.csproj] [C:\git\NuGet.Client\build\build.proj]


  Expected: True
  Actual:   False
    Stack Trace:
     at Dotnet.Integration.Test.MsbuildIntegrationTestFixture.RestoreProjectOrSolution(String workingDirectory, String fileName, String args) in C:\git\NuGet.Client\test\NuGet.Core.FuncTests\Dotnet.Integration.Test\MsbuildIntegrationTestFixture.cs:line 152
     at Dotnet.Integration.Test.MsbuildIntegrationTestFixture.RestoreProject(String workingDirectory, String projectName, String args) in C:\git\NuGet.Client\test\NuGet.Core.FuncTests\Dotnet.Integration.Test\MsbuildIntegrationTestFixture.cs:line 137
     at Dotnet.Integration.Test.PackCommandTests.PackCommand_PackProject_PackageReferenceFloatingVersionRange() in C:\git\NuGet.Client\test\NuGet.Core.FuncTests\Dotnet.Integration.Test\PackCommandTests.cs:line 251
```

As part of fixing this we should replace external URL's (modulo nuget.org) with local test URL's.  For example, this test hits https://test3.net, which is easily mockable with a local test endpoint.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "nuget.exe add doesn't recognize named sources" (#8391) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
## Details about Problem

NuGet product used (NuGet.exe | VS UI | Package Manager Console | dotnet.exe): nuget.exe

NuGet version (x.x.x.xxx): 5.1.0.6013

dotnet.exe --version (if appropriate):

VS version (if appropriate):

OS version (i.e. win10 v1607 (14393.321)): win10 v1709 (16299.1217)

Worked before? If so, with which NuGet version: No

## Detailed repro steps so we can see the same problem

1. `nuget sources add -name local -source c:\mypackages`
2. `nuget add mypackage.nupkg -source local`

At this point, I would expect to see `mypackage.nupkg` installed under `c:\mypackages`, but instead it's installed under a new directory called `local` under my current folder.

`nuget list -source local` returns no packages (because it's looking at the source named `local`)

### Verbose logs
```
Î» nuget add -source local mypackage.1.0.nupkg -verbosity detailed
NuGet Version: 5.1.0.6013
Acquiring lock for the installation of mypackage 1.0
Acquired lock for the installation of mypackage 1.0
Installing mypackage 1.0
Completed installation of mypackage 1.0
Successfully added package 'mypackage.1.0.nupkg' to feed 'local'.
```

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "csproj equivalent to licence " (#8389) at NuGet/Home
Events.RelatedBody:
I usually push a nuget by using 

    dotnet pack -c release

followed by:

    nuget push <package> -source nuget.org

Today suddenly I got a 403 error when trying to push. After spending a good amount of time creating api keys and restarting, I tried uploading manually from nuget.org. This shows me the error 

> All published packages should have license information specified.

The documentation says to use <license type="file">license\license.txt</license> in the .nuspec. I prefer not to have to update the .nuspec everytime and update the csproj file instead. I can't find any documentation pointing to what is to be used in the .csproj in order to generate this license tag. I have tried :

     <PackageLicense>none</PackageLicense>
      <License>none</License>

Trying `type="file"` crashes the project. I have also tried adding a License.txt file.
